availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Hopkins County, Kentucky, farmer. Kentucky native. Son of Nancy Davis. Married to Dicy Davis. Father of David Davis, William M. Davis, James P. Davis, George M. Davis, Melissa Davis, Catherine G. Davis, K. H. Davis, Benjamin Davis, and Lavinia J. Davis. Farmer in Hopkins County, Kentucky, in 1850. Farmer in Hopkins County in 1860. Owned five enslaved persons in Hopkins County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Hopkins County, District 1, p. 61A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Hopkins County, p. 800.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Hopkins County, p. 218A.
"Israel Davis (1814-1880)," Find A Grave, Memorial #25172361, accessed October 7, 2021, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/25172361.
